alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Decatur; Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 3:41AM CST until March 09 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...A mix of freezing drizzle, light freezing rain and dense freezing fog. Ice accumulations ranging from a trace to several hundredths of an inch are expected. Localized ice accumulation up to one tenth of an inch possible, mainly in Norton county, Kansas. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions associated with freezing drizzle and dense freezing fog. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 2 AM MST, patchy ice has continues to be observed on sidewalks and parking lots in Goodland, Kansas. Visibility reductions down to less than 1 mile due to fog have been reported across the region as well this morning. Treacherous travel conditions may develop across portions of the advisory area this morning, especially along and north of Interstate 70 where temperatures will remain several degrees below freezing. Conditions will rapidly improve from west to east late this morning, as winds shift out of the northwest and gust up to around 40 mph.
info.instruction: If traveling, slow down, turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution, especially at intersections and highway on- ramps and off-ramps where accidents are more likely to occur. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
